body:
I suspect the spack recipe for gnutls does not configure the guile
dependency correctly.  For me, a plain `spack install gnutls` from
today's checkout (88473a8da) fails in the config test for guile
(+guile is the default).

```
spack install -v gnutls
...
*** Detecting GNU Guile...

checking for guile-snarf... /home/krentel/gnutls/install/linux-fedora26-x86_64/gcc-7.3.1/guile-2.2.0-75otw6flosxdwhqg34ssilmgmxheaeae/bin/guile-snarf
checking for guild... /home/krentel/gnutls/install/linux-fedora26-x86_64/gcc-7.3.1/guile-2.2.0-75otw6flosxdwhqg34ssilmgmxheaeae/bin/guild
checking for pkg-config... (cached) /home/krentel/gnutls/install/linux-fedora26-x86_64/gcc-7.3.1/pkgconf-1.6.0-2hrubmn7tbszxx5ujal5nweramdldzsu/bin/pkg-config
checking pkg-config is at least version 0.9.0... yes
configure: checking for guile 2.2
configure: found guile 2.2
checking for guile-2.2... no
checking for guile2.2... no
checking for guile-2... no
checking for guile2... /usr/bin/guile2
configure: error: found development files for Guile 2.2, but /usr/bin/guile2 has effective version 2.0
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/home/krentel/gnutls/spack-repo/var/spack/stage/gnutls-3.6.8-kdysvilufknhd54qejpcbtnovfrrkaj4/gnutls-3.6.8/configure' '--prefix=/home/krentel/gnutls/install/linux-fedora26-x86_64/gcc-7.3.1/gnutls-3.6.8-kdysvilufknhd54qejpcbtnovfrrkaj4' '--enable-static' '--with-included-libtasn1' '--with-included-unistring' '--without-p11-kit' '--with-zlib' '--enable-guile' '--disable-tests' '--disable-valgrind-tests' '--disable-full-test-suite'

1 error found in build log:
     912    configure: checking for guile 2.2
     913    configure: found guile 2.2
     914    checking for guile-2.2... no
     915    checking for guile2.2... no
     916    checking for guile-2... no
     917    checking for guile2... /usr/bin/guile2
  >> 918    configure: error: found development files for Guile 2.2, but /usr/bin/guile2 has effective version 2.0
```

The spack recipe for gnutls already has:
```
depends_on('guile', when='+guile')
...
if '+guile' in spec:
    args.append('--enable-guile')
```

The error message suggests that gnutls configure needs some additional
args to find the spack-built guile over /usr/bin.

This also breaks the build for cmake because gnutls is now a
dependency for cmake.  (Which is where I saw this, I don't use gnutls
directly.)

A temporary workaround is `gnutls~guile`.

Investigations continue ....

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```
spack install gnutls
```

### Platform and user environment

x86_64, Linux Fedora 26, gcc 7.3.1, gnu glibc-2.25-13.fc26.x86_64

Packages.yaml is empty except for perl and python from /usr/bin.

```
packages:
  perl:
    paths:
      perl@5.24.4:  /usr
    buildable: False

  python:
    paths:
      python@2.7.15:  /usr
    buildable: False
```

### Additional information

The prereqs all built cleanly.

```
        ^bzip2@1.0.6%gcc@7.3.1+shared arch=linux-fedora26-x86_64
            ^diffutils@3.7%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-fedora26-x86_64

            ^automake@1.16.1%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-fedora26-x86_64

        ^libunistring@0.9.10%gcc@7.3.1 arch=linux-fedora26-x86_64

```
title: build error in gnutls and cmake
